summary: The Access to Credit for our Rural Economy Act of 2025 (ACRE Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income the interest received by qualified lenders on certain loans secured by rural or agricultural real property. The bill defines qualified lenders and real estate loans, also including single-family residences and aquaculture facilities. It also addresses how it should be coordinated with section 265 and requires a report to Congress on its impact in 5 years after enactment. The effective date is for taxable years ending after the date of enactment.
